title: Workplace/Organizational Layer Value Recognition for Student
description: As a student working part-time to support educational and basic needs Operating at the workplace/organizational governance layer I want fair treatment, recognition of my constraints, and care economy awareness So that my work supports rather than undermines my development and well-being

Feature: Workplace/Organizational Layer Value Recognition for Student
  As a student working part-time to support educational and basic needs
  Operating at the workplace/organizational governance layer
  I want fair treatment, recognition of my constraints, and care economy awareness
  So that my work supports rather than undermines my development and well-being

  Background:
    Given the Elohim Protocol is operational
    And the student user "Kenji" is registered in the system
    And Kenji works part-time 15 hours per week
    And Kenji's work income is essential for basic expenses
    And Kenji must balance work hours with academic demands
    And Kenji works in service industry (restaurant or retail)
    And the workplace governance context is active
    And the workplace_elohim could support worker rights and fair treatment
    And Kenji is learning to navigate employment for first time

  Scenario: Work schedule flexibility for academic obligations
    Given Kenji must attend classes and cannot work during certain hours
    And exam periods require reduced work availability
    When Kenji's workplace_elohim advocates for schedule flexibility
    Then it should help Kenji communicate academic constraints to employer
    And it should support negotiating exam week time off
    And it should recognize that flexible scheduling is care economy practice
    And employers should accommodate student educational needs
    And the system should help Kenji assert right to education
    And work should support student development, not undermine it

  Scenario: Fair compensation and wage theft prevention
    Given Kenji depends on every dollar he earns
    And low-wage employers sometimes violate wage laws
    When the workplace_elohim monitors Kenji's compensation
    Then it should verify he's paid for all hours worked
    And it should flag if he's working off-clock or unpaid
    And it should teach him to recognize wage theft
    And it should help him assert right to legal minimum wage
    And the system should protect vulnerable student workers from exploitation
    And Kenji should receive every penny he earns

  Scenario: Understanding labor rights as student worker
    Given Kenji has same labor rights as any employee
    And many students don't know their workplace rights
    When the workplace_elohim educates Kenji about labor law
    Then it should teach him about breaks, overtime, workplace safety
    And it should inform him of right to organize and unionize
    And it should help him recognize illegal employer practices
    And it should empower him to advocate for fair treatment
    And the system should build Kenji's labor rights literacy
    And student workers should know and exercise their rights

  Scenario: Recognizing when work serves vs. exploits community needs
    Given Kenji works in service industry
    And service work can serve community care or extract from workers
    When the workplace_elohim helps Kenji analyze his work
    Then it should help him see whether his work contributes to community flourishing
    And it should teach him to distinguish care work from extractive labor
    And it should recognize that serving food can be care economy work
    And it should help him evaluate whether his workplace aligns with care values
    And the system should build critical awareness of workplace care economy
    And Kenji should understand his labor through care economy lens

  Scenario: Workplace relationships and peer support
    Given Kenji works with other employees, many also students
    And workplace can be site of mutual support or competition
    When the workplace_elohim tracks workplace relationships
    Then it should recognize peer support among coworkers as care work
    And it should value helping coworkers, sharing shifts, covering emergencies
    And it should accumulate care tokens for workplace mutual aid
    And worker solidarity should be understood as care economy
    And the system should foster cooperative rather than competitive workplace culture
    And Kenji should build care relationships with fellow workers

  Scenario: Preventing workplace stress from undermining academic success
    Given Kenji's work adds stress to already-intense academic load
    And excessive work hours can threaten educational outcomes
    When the workplace_elohim monitors Kenji's work-study balance
    Then it should flag when work hours threaten academic performance
    And it should help him identify when to reduce hours
    And it should validate that education is his primary work right now
    And it should support him prioritizing school over work when necessary
    And the system should prevent work from derailing educational investment
    And Kenji's long-term development should take precedence over immediate income

  Scenario: Workplace skills as transferable care economy capabilities
    Given Kenji develops skills through work (customer service, teamwork, reliability)
    And these capabilities serve him throughout life
    When the workplace_elohim documents Kenji's skill development
    Then it should recognize customer service as care economy skill
    And it should value teamwork, communication, and problem-solving
    And it should translate work skills to care economy capabilities
    And it should help Kenji articulate skills for future opportunities
    And the system should recognize all work as capability development
    And Kenji should understand his part-time work as building life skills

  Scenario: Employer care economy responsibility to student workers
    Given Kenji is vulnerable worker with limited experience and options
    And employers have care economy responsibility to workers
    When the workplace_elohim evaluates Kenji's workplace
    Then it should assess whether employer provides fair wages, safe conditions, and flexibility
    And it should recognize good employers who support student success
    And it should flag exploitative practices or toxic culture
    And it should help Kenji identify better employment if current job is harmful
    And the system should hold employers accountable to care economy standards
    And workplaces should support student worker flourishing

  Scenario: Emergency work flexibility for student crises
    Given students face emergencies (illness, family crisis, housing instability)
    And rigid work schedules can worsen crises
    When Kenji experiences emergency situation
    Then the workplace_elohim should help him communicate need for emergency time off
    And it should advocate for employer flexibility during crisis
    And it should recognize emergency accommodation as care economy practice
    And employers should support workers through crises
    And the system should help Kenji access emergency workplace support
    And care economy workplaces respond to worker emergencies with flexibility

  Scenario: Preventing employer pressure to prioritize work over education
    Given some employers pressure students to work more hours
    And employer interests can conflict with student educational needs
    When employer requests Kenji increase hours or skip classes for work
    Then the workplace_elohim should help Kenji maintain boundaries
    And it should validate his right to prioritize education
    And it should provide language for declining inappropriate requests
    And it should recognize that education is his primary work
    And the system should support students resisting employer overreach
    And Kenji should have agency to protect his educational investment

  Scenario: Understanding workplace labor as care economy contribution
    Given Kenji serves food to community members
    And service work directly contributes to people's daily needs
    When the workplace_elohim frames his work through care economy
    Then it should recognize that feeding people is care work
    And it should value service labor as community care contribution
    And it should accumulate care tokens for workplace care labor
    And it should help Kenji see his work as meaningful contribution
    And the system should dignify service work as care economy participation
    And Kenji should understand his labor as serving community flourishing

  Scenario: Worker organizing and collective advocacy
    Given student workers often face systemic workplace problems
    And collective action can create change
    When Kenji and coworkers organize for better conditions
    Then the workplace_elohim should recognize organizing as care economy work
    And it should support collective advocacy for fair wages and treatment
    And it should accumulate care tokens for organizing labor
    And it should protect his right to organize without retaliation
    And the system should empower student worker collective action
    And Kenji should learn that workers have power through solidarity

  Scenario: Transitioning work experience to career aligned with care values
    Given Kenji's current work is survival job, not career goal
    And he wants future work aligned with environmental care
    When the workplace_elohim supports career development
    Then it should help him connect current work skills to future career
    And it should support him finding work aligned with care economy values
    And it should recognize his environmental science education as preparing for care work
    And it should help him transition toward meaningful career
    And the system should support students developing care-aligned career paths
    And Kenji's work trajectory should move toward work that serves flourishing
